title: Laundry on the intermediate festival days
vignette: Tourists ran out of clean clothes halfway through the holiday week. Is doing laundry permitted when no fresh garments remain, or is all washing postponed until after the festival?

options.text: Yes, if no clean garments remain.
No laundry at all during the festival.

title: Scribe taking paid jobs mid-festival
vignette: A freelance copy-editor is offered work during the holiday week. She needs the income to cover festival expenses. May she accept the job, or should she refrain and rely on savings?

options.text: He may work to prevent financial loss.
He should refrain and rely on savings.

title: Trimming hair before a funeral
vignette: A mourner learns of a relative's passing during the festival and wants a haircut before the funeral.

options.text: Allow the haircut due to honouring the deceased.
Haircuts remain forbidden even in mourning.

title: Emergency wall repair
vignette: A storm topples part of a backyard wall during the festival week, leaving the property exposed. Can the owner rebuild a temporary barrier now, or must repairs wait?

options.text: Rebuild it temporarily to safeguard the property.
Delay repairs until after the festival.

title: Watering ornamental plants
vignette: Ornamental shrubs around the house are wilting. They're not food crops. May one water them sparingly to keep them alive, or is non-essential gardening prohibited?

options.text: Water them sparingly to prevent loss.
No watering non-essential plants.

title: Writing personal letters
vignette: A traveler wishes to send holiday greetings home. Is casual letter writing permitted?

options.text: Yes; personal letters of joy are allowed.
Avoid writing except for business needs.

title: Engagement party during the holiday
vignette: A couple wants to hold their engagement celebration during the festival. Some say combining celebrations diminishes each. Should they go ahead or postpone?

options.text: Hold the party; joy is appropriate now.
Delay until after the festival.

title: Fixing a broken sandal strap
vignette: A sandal strap snaps while walking. Is hiring a cobbler for this minor repair allowed, or should one switch shoes until after the holiday?

options.text: Yes; minor repairs that prevent discomfort are allowed.
No; wear different shoes until after the festival.

title: Court sessions on Chol HaMoed
vignette: A civil dispute is scheduled for the intermediate days. Should the court postpone the hearing?

options.text: Hold the session to deliver timely justice.
Delay legal proceedings until after the holiday.

title: Plowing for next season as a demo
vignette: A farmer considers plowing next season's field during the holiday so visitors can watch. The work isn't urgent for current crops. Allowed, or prohibited future-oriented labor?

options.text: He may plow for the sake of the festival crowd.
Plowing for later benefit is prohibited.

title: Hobby weaving during down-time
vignette: With free hours, someone wants to continue a personal weaving project. The finished cloth won't be needed for months. Is light hobby work permitted?

options.text: Weaving can wait; avoid weekday labor.
She may weave casually for enjoyment.

title: Public mourning gatherings
vignette: A respected teacher dies during the festival. Should large public eulogies be held right away?

options.text: Hold modest funerals and wait with full eulogies.
Proceed with full honors despite the festival.

title: Issuing a public ban mid-festival
vignette: Community leaders wish to censure a disruptive member during the holiday week. Should they announce the ban now to protect others, or delay until festivities end?

options.text: Announce the ban now to protect others.
Postpone until after the holiday.

title: Taking short vocational lessons
vignette: Time off from regular work leaves an individual free to sign up for brief skills classes. Is self-improvement coursework appropriate during the festival, or should they focus solely on holiday activities?

options.text: Permissible since it's for livelihood.
Better to focus on holiday spirit instead.

title: Cutting nails
vignette: Are ordinary people allowed to trim their nails during Chol HaMoed, or is it restricted like haircuts?

options.text: Trimming nails is allowed.
It should be avoided unless necessary.
